bibl.title: R. al-Ittiḥād al-kawnī
رسالة الإتحاد الكوني
Epistle in which is shown how the creature rediscovers the mnunity to which his essential being bears witness, and how he is brought into the presence of the human tree and the four spiritual birds.
bibl.explicit: Closing Words of Text (exclusive of any rubric or colophon which might follow it).
bibl.author: Ibn al-ʿArabī
bibl.date: Terminus post quem and terminus ante quem
bibl.note: A letter was written by IA for Abū l-Fawāris Ṣakhr b. Sinān (Vel.51/48a)

noteGrp.note: A poetical work on the perfect human being (al-insān al-kāmil), the supreme intellect, the guarded tablet, the materia prima, and the universal body. One of IA’s earlier Maghribi works. See Angela Jaffray’s introduction and translation, The Universal Tree and the Four Birds (Oxford, 2005).

bibl.note: OY cites 21 mss., of which three are historic mss. The best are Shehit Ali 2813 (621H, written by Ayyūb b. Badr in the presence of IA) and Veliyuddin 51 (c. 762H, copied from al-Ḥabashī’s original).
